gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class Replicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.Replicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Replicator
extends EdgeThread
    This is an EdgeThread that takes any data from the EdgeBlockQueue, creates, and writes the replicated files onto this node. It uses the IndexFileReplicator for handling the files. It also creates IndexCheckers for each file when it is created. This object does the reconciliation between the index and check files and issues requests for missing blocks to insure all of the blocks are replicated - including through software shutdowns. In it's main loop, it also does common clean up duties like closing files which have not been used recently. For a replication to occur one or more EdgeBlockClients must be configured on this instance to get the data from some remote instance which must be running an EdgeBlockServer and IndexFileServer thread.
    NOTES : Replicators running on a CWB-CWB connection must have a -cwbcwb ip.adr on their command line. In Edge-to-CWB mode the address of the place to get Index files on startup are obtained from the EdgeBlockClient going to that node. In CWB-CWB there are no node-by-node EdgeBlockClients, just a client to the cwb. This replicator switch lets the replicator know this is the case and provides the IP address. 
     It is an EdgeThread with the following arguments :
 Tag   arg          Description
 -dbg                Turn on debugging
 -dbgrep             Turn on debugging in IndexFileReplicator
 -dbgibc             Turn on debugging in IndexFileCheck
 -dbgebq             Turn on debugging in EdgeBlockQueue
 -dbgichk            Turn on debugging in the IndexCheckers.
 -cwbcwb            This is a cwb-to-cwb replicator so IP addressing is correct
 -limit   n          Limit output files to n days ago - used on non-CWB like gldpsd.
 -stalesec  nn       The number of seconds a file needs to be unused to qualify as stale
 >[>]  filename     You can redirect output from this thread to the filename in the current logging directory

      • Replicator

        public Replicator(java.lang.String argline,
                  java.lang.String tag)
        Creates a new instance of ReplicatorThread.

        Arguments are :
        -dbg Turn on debugging
        -dbgrep Turn on debugging in IndexFileReplicator
        -dbgibc Turn on debugging in IndexFileCheck
        -dbgebq Turn on debugging in EdgeBlockQueue
        -limit n Limit output files to n days ago.
        > To redirect output from this thread to an individual file
        Parameters:
        argline - The edgemom.setup line which started this thread
        tag - The edgemom.setup tag portion to be used as the beginning of this thread's tag

      • run

        public void run()
        This run() reads any data as it comes into the EdgeBlockQueue and writes it out to the data and index file. It also periodically closes files if they have not been used for a long time!
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getFullIndex

        public boolean getFullIndex(IndexFileReplicator file,
                            byte[] buf,
                            boolean first)
        Connect to the IndexFileServer and get the index and inject it.
        Parameters:
        file - The IndexFileReplicator to do this for.
        buf - A buffer at least 512 bytes long to use as scratch space.
        first - First time, do raw writes to file.
        Returns:
        True if index was successfully obtained.
